item.title: Hong Kong | HRW requires release from activist father
item.description: The Human Rights Watch organization yesterday called for the release of the Hong Kong Anna Kwok human rights defender, detained in late April, and denounced the harassment of territory authorities to family members of activists. Hong Kong police detained the father of the rooted activist in the United States Anna Kwok, "and accused him of a national security crime," he began writing in a statement to Human Rights Watch (HRW), which requires the release of Kwok Yin-Sang and being "immediately withdrawn all charges." Hong Kong National Security Police announced on Friday the arrest of Kwok's father and brother, accused of trying to manage the activist's financial resources. According to police sources, this is the first time that the controversial national security law is applied that criminalizes assistance to “designated fugitives” in the management of the assets that hold. According to the EFE agency on Friday, Hong Kong authorities detained 35 and 68-yearly Anna Kwok's brother and father in Tseung Kwan O district on April 30 and accused the last of trying to raise funds from an insurance policy on the name of their daughter, presenting documents with allegedly false signatures. Anna Kwok, 28, lives in the United States and is a executive director of the Hong Kong Democracy Council, a US -based non -profit organization and created to promote freedoms in China. Although the father remains detained, his brother, an employee of the insurance company who manages Kwok's policies, was released under bail and is being investigated for possible abuse of office to facilitate the operation. Also according to EFE, the authorities have reiterated the warning that anyone who collaborates with “designated fugitives” incurs heavy penalties that can go up to seven years in prison.

item.title: Zone A | Worker and excavator fall into the sea
item.description:
The consortium of the companies Top Builders and state China Road and Bridge Corporation is responsible for the works of connecting to the peninsula, for which it will receive 608.8 million patacas. The proposal of these companies exceeded 80 million other participants in the contest
Photo: A worker and a large excavator fell into the sea on Friday morning after the collapse of a provisional bridge for the construction of the A3 connection between zone A of the new urban landfills and the Macao Peninsula. The accident was captured in images, which ended up shared on social networks. The claim happened in less than 20 seconds. The man was thrown into the sea because he was inside the excavating machine that had made the temporary structure not stand. It was eventually saved with the help of their colleagues, who shot him a float, already after being able to get out of the machine, still in the sea. Hours later, in a statement, the Directorate of Public Works Services (DSOP), the Directorate of Maritime and Water Affairs Services (DSAMA) and the Directorate for Labor Services (DSAL) confirmed the accident and the existence of slight injuries. "At the shipping and construction of the access road (A3) between zone A of the new urban landfills and the Macao Peninsula, there was an incident in which a building machine and its operator fell into the sea, due to the partial collapse of the provisional easel bridge, and the operator left the sea by himself and was transported to the hospital by the contractor." “It is preliminary to the operator involved was slightly injured and was conscious after the incident, and will undergo a detailed medical inspection,” he was added. The authorities also considered that the incident had “great importance” and asked for a total suspension of the work. In turn, DSSA has ensured that the worker will help compensation for the successful, since it suffered mild injuries, while DSOP has required the “contractor and the supervisory entity to fully collaborate with the administration in the investigation of the causes of the incident”. Sanctions were also promised, if it considered that there was a responsibility of the two parties. MILLION WORK The construction of the A3 connection between the zone A of the new urban landfills and the Macao Peninsula has as its contractor the consortium consisting of the companies Top Builders and the state China Road and Bridge Corporation. These won the public tender for the construction of the work for 608.8 million patacas, promising to do the work in 855 days. The proposal was the fourth cheapest of the 10 presented, and all had a time of doing the 855 -day work. However, at least one of the proposals, presented by the consortium consisting of the Ming Shun Building and Building Investment Company and Long Chon Construction and Engineering Society promised to do the same work by 528.0 million patacas, a difference of over 80 million patacas.

item.title: Banking | Profits shoot 44.8% in the first quarter
item.description:
Banks made profits of 3.76 billion patacas in the first quarter, according to official data from the Monetary Authority of Macau (AMCM)
Banks made profits of 3.76 billion patacas in the first quarter, 44.8 percent than in the same period as 2024. According to official data from the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM), the main reason for the rise was banking services and operations, whose revenues increased 42.1 percent to 2.76 billion patacas. The data, released on Friday, also reveal that financial investments yielded 528.6 million Patacas, three times more than in the first three months of last year. In the opposite direction, the Macau banking fell from 3.1 percent to 3.75 billion, on the interest margin, the difference between loan revenues and deposit expenses. This after the AMCM approved three descents of the main reference interest rate in the last three months of 2024, the last of which a 0.25 percentage points, introduced on December 19, following the US Federal Reserve. Macao banks made a profit of 4.01 billion patacas by 2024, a drop of 21.3 percent and the lowest value since 2010, especially due to the fall of interest margin. The loans, the main source of revenue of the banking worldwide, decreased 4.7 percent in the last 12 months, setting 1.02 billion of patacas in late March. Sickly On the contrary, deposits with Macau banks increased by 10.3 percent to 1.36 billion of patacas, AMCM said. Macau Banking Credit Credit fell 2.7 percent in March to 56.1 billion patacas, after February reached the highest value since AMCM began compiling this data in 1990. In March, overdue loans represented 5.5 percent of Macao banks loans, more than 1.3 percentage points than in the same month as 2023. A percentage that reaches 6.7 percent in the case of credit to institutions or individuals outside the Chinese region. The European banking authority, the EU regulatory agency, for example, considers that banks with at least 5 percent of poorly misplaced loans have “high exposure” at risk and should establish a strategy to solve the problem. Still, the percentage of bank credit overdue in Macau is far from the 25.3 percent record reached in mid -2001, in the middle of the world economic crisis caused by the buzzing of the speculative bubble of companies linked to the internet.

item.title: GDP | Macao with the first reduction since the end of 2022
item.description:
The increase of tourists in the territory was not reflected in consumption in the first three months of the year. The drop in gross domestic product compared to the same period does not yet take into account the potential effects of the trade war
Macao's economy shrank 1.3 percent in homologous terms in the first quarter of this year, the first fall since the end of 2022, when the region began to raise restrictions due to the pandemic, was announced on Friday. Between January and March, Macao Gross Domestic Product (GDP) reached 99.78 billion Patacas, the Board of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) said. In a statement issued on Friday, DSEC pointed out as reasons for the decrease the “relatively high comparison base” of the first quarter of 2024 and the “change of visitor consumption pattern”. The economic benefit of tourist services - the sector that dominates Macau's economy - fell 3.8 percent, although the first trimester was the second best ever about the number of visitors. According to official data, Macau received 9.86 million tourists by March 11.1 percent than in the same period of 2024, but visitors have spent less in the city. The latest data point to a 14.6 percent drop in tourist per capita expense over the last year. Macao's economy grew 23 percent in the first quarter of 2024 and ended the year up 8.8 percent. The last time the region's GDP was at the end of 2022. Continental China-by far the main source of visitors from Macau-began to gradually raise all restrictions due to Covid-19 pandemic in mid-December 2022. “Stable looking” Despite the reduction of GDP, DSEC stressed that internal demand was “relatively stable”, with private investment rising 7.8 percent, government expenses increasing 1 percent and private consumption to grow 0.6 percent. On April 10, the University of Macao (one) reviewed the forecast for economic growth in the region, in part due to the potential impact of the tariffs imposed by the United States on the confidence of Chinese tourists. The Macao Study Center and the department of Economics of UM predict that the territory GDP rose 6.8 percent, 1.1 percentage points than in the previous forecast, made in January. Project coordinator and economist Kwan Fung said the low review is due to the decline in the consumption of visitors and the "US world tariffs," something that "has an indirect impact on Macao's economy." UM Economy Department professor said the fares will "affect the growth of all economies, especially the consumption of tourists in the interior of China." In early March, the Financial Notation Agency Fitch predicted that the growth of Macau's economy will slow down to 6.9 percent this year, due to a “slower” recovery of tourism and game. "However, a sharp slowdown in the Chinese economy, such as the substantial increases in US tariffs, and a strong yuan devaluation pose negative risks to Macao's perspectives," said Fitch.

item.title: Worker Day | Detained in the first protest in six years
item.description:
Police detained on the day of the worker a man protesting the number of migrant workers in Macao, invoking violation of the Law of Meeting and Manifestation Law. Also the Power of the People's Association canceled a demonstration, after the authorities suggested not wanting to debut the application of the law on the security of the state
On May 1, Labor Day, a man was arrested by agents of the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) when manifested against the importation of non-resident workers. CPSP source told Lusa that man showed 'slogans' (slogans) and chanting chants to demand the reduction of migrant workers at the door of the management services for the first public protest on May 1, 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic. A video that circulates on social networks shows the man to put eight sheets of paper on the floor with the message “Government, cut on migrant workers! next to the flags of Macao and China. The Mishes was employed at the end of March nearly 183,400,000 migrant workers, still far from the maximum peak of 196,538, hit in late 2019 at the beginning of the pandemic. According to the CPSP, the agents made repeated warnings for violations of the Law of Meeting and Manifestation Law, but the man refused to obey and was taken to the squad to be identified. During the pandemic, security forces refused to approve the course of any protest, invoking reasons for “order and safety” or public health. Authorities raised anti-standard restrictions at the end of 2023, but the protests did not return to the city streets. These prohibitions arrived at the UN Human Rights Committee, which in 2022 evaluated "an increasing number of information of improper restrictions on the exercise of freedom of peaceful manifestations." It would be a pity The Power of the People's Association, which also requires a reduction in the number of migrant workers, canceled a manifestation planned for Labor Day due to “police pressure,” the All About Macau newspaper reported on Thursday. The association said it expected 20,000 participants, but canceled the event after police claimed that it could violate the National Security Act. Group President Lam Weng Ioi said he filed a formal statement of demonstration in April, but was summoned to repeated police meetings to "analyze the situation" and "avoid uncontrollable circumstances." Lam claimed that the authorities raised questions about the “joint responsibility of the organizers” and the warning of “National Security”, which led the group to present a written appeal. Speaking to the Macao TDM channel, the associative leader said that the authorities advanced various possibilities such as the intervention of “people with bad intentions” that could take advantage of the activities to create confusion, or from participants who could compromise public order, and that the association would be responsible for any disorder or irregularity. "We said we were going to have a special team to maintain order. However, police officers doubted our ability to control local order," Lam Weng Ioi told public television. The authorities also suggested that the manifestation of Labor Day could infringe national security laws. "It was mentioned, indirectly, (the violation of) law on the defense of state security. I was told that there was no detention, previously, based on this law and that they did not want us to be the first case of law on the defense of state security," said the president of the Power of the People Association. The PSP confirmed that it had received a statement notification for May 1, but said the organizer removed it voluntarily. Au Kam San disagree Following the case of the individual detained for protesting the importation of non-resident workers to Macao, at the gates of the management of services for labor affairs, on the day of the worker, former deputy Au Kam San argued that the act concerned was not a demonstration. As such, the action of public security police officers was not correct. In a Facebook publication, the former deputy disagreed with the police argument that the subject had not prior notice to the demonstration because he is only an individual and a small-scale protest and that the concept of manifestation depends on the number of people involved. Even so, it pointed out that there is no necessary authorization for notice of demonstration, a fundamental right provided for in the basic law of masters.

item.title: PME | Events promoted by Melco generated $ 1 million
item.description:
Melco Resorts claims to have generated about $ 1 million for small and medium -sized local businesses through events promoted last year. In the 2024 sustainability report, the game operator also highlights the results in terms of waste management and energy spending
The Melco Resorts & Entertainment Sustainability Report has just been published last year, which highlights the gains obtained by small and medium -sized (SMEs) with the events promoted by the operator. With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. Regarding the company's training actions, Melco says it has invested on average "582 US dollars per full -time worker in learning and development activities, which is equivalent to an average of 38 hours of training." In this context, “100 percent of colleagues participated in training actions”, can be read. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. One of the areas that is “in progress” is the energy consumption, in order to obtain more reasonableness of consumption. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." One of the “achieved” objectives is the energy efficiency measures, which “since 2018 has resulted in an annualized savings of more than 62.5 million kWh, an increase of 9 percent compared to 2023”. Another "achieved" goal concerns the installation of "over 25,000 photovoltaic panels on all properties in Macau, Manila and Cyprus, generating about 10,000 kWh annually." Thus, in the properties of Melco "the electricity consumption from renewable sources increased by 72 percent compared to 2023". Regarding the group's means of transportation, “buses, electric and hybrid vehicles represent 55 percent of our combined fleet, with loading stations, an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023”. In terms of materials and waste management, Melco says it has avoided plastic spending in the order of 13.2 million bottles, thanks to the installation of “the Nordaq water filtering system that serves almost every hotel rooms in Melco's integrated resorts”. In addition, the example of the City of Dreams venture in Manila is presented where “a circular economy system was established in which food waste is decomposed on site, and the excess donated to a local fifth to cultivate some of the vegetables served to guests”. In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023 ″. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unwavering, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our food and drink points in Macao and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.title: Taipa Village | Frank Lei Exhibition on Exhibition from Tomorrow
item.description:
The Vila da Taipa Cultural Association presents tomorrow “Frank Law: Cuba 92”, an exhibition of photography dedicated to the artist based in Macau and deceased in 2022. Here is the opportunity to see images of Cuba 1992, never before shown, in which it is a tribute to Frank Lei
He was born in Beijing and since he had lived in Macau. Frank Law, a man dedicated to the arts and photography, died in 2022 victim of prolonged illness, but is now entitled to a tribute through the display of his work. This is the exhibition “Frank Law: Cuba 92”, evident from tomorrow, and until July 9, at the Vila da Taipa Cultural Association, with unpublished images captured by law in Cuba, in 1992. According to a statement from the organization, Frank Lei passed away leaving "a vast set of photographic works that remain little known to the general public." In this way, this show was born of the joint effort of family, friends and, above all, Alan Ieong Chon Weng, one of the founders of the Dialect group, dedicated to photography. “In 1992, Frank Law first traveled to Cuba, visiting not only the capital, Havana, but also Santiago de Cuba, in the eastern part of the island, demonstrating his deep attention and exploitation of Cuban culture and community,” says the organization, not only the artist launched not only an exhibition, but also a book with these images, with the name “Cuba Cuba”. This project included “selected works, filmed in color diaper”, constituting “the core of a narrative that presented a vibrant and living impression of the island nation”. In addition, Frank Law files on Cuba "include a set of unpublished black and white photographs, monochrome images that capture everyday life and the emotions of the Cuban people from a more subtle and contained perspective." Now, with this new exhibition, the display of these black and white images never revealed to the public "offers a new window in time and space, allowing the viewer to know the island's landscape that so much captivated the soul of Frank and which constitutes the invisible side of his trip to Cuba." "The initiative to bring to light these works is a recognition of the relevance of photography to document human realities and the circumstances of people's lives. Spectators have the opportunity to revisit Frank's works not only, but also to embrace the emotions they evoke about the survival of a society and a country as a Cuba," the organization highlights. Quoted by the same note, João Ó, architect and president of the Vila da Taipa Cultural Association, said it was “an honor to collaborate with Dialect to present this unprecedented collection of black and white photographs of Frank to Cuba's trip”. “The selection of photographs pays tribute to Frank's singular dedication to artistic and cultural creative industries over the years and shows the passion for Cuban culture that has impregnated his heart and soul,” he adds. A man from Macau Born in Beijing, Frank came to Macau at the age of ten. He graduated in journalism and worked as a reporter in the newspaper or Mun after the degree. Then he fell in love with the French cinema of the so-called “New Vacancy”, having gone to Paris to study cinema and video at the University of Sorbonne in 1991. In the same year, he was admitted at École Nationale Supérieure des Arts Décoratifs de Paris, where he studied photography, and also won the first award in the International Photography Contest “Life on the Street”, organized by the Musée de La Photographie. Frank Lei exposed his images on the Grand Palais de Paris, being part of the permanent collection of Musée de la photographie. In 1992, Frank traveled to Cuba to work in artistic projects and even waved to President Fidel Castro, highlights the organization of the exhibition. He then returned to Macau, where he taught at the School of Arts of the Macao Polytechnic Institute, today Macao Polytechnic University. “Cinema, photography, music and literature were Frank's passions throughout his life and, right after his return to Macau, embraced Buddhism, bringing a simple and vegetarian lifestyle,” he says. Frank Law was exposing his work in France, Macau and Hong Kong. In 1995, he founded the Macao Pedra Commune Artistic Group. In 2004, two years after his first exhibition about Cuba, it was found that Frank suffered from cancer in his brain. After treatment, he returned to the then Macao Polytechnic Institute, continued to work in the ox warehouse and began drawing extensively during his recovery. In 2006, he published the photographic anthology “walking and observing” with Pin-to Books. He continued to photograph and create paintings, organizing individual exhibitions and small painting exhibitions, and traveled to New York, South Korea and France for exchanges and photographic shows. In early 2017, Frank was invited to Strasbourg Art Photography, a permanent festival of photography in France, for a photographic exhibition and an exchange. After the disease, Frank Law died on May 18, 2022.

item.title: Xanana Gusmão asks Timorese to encourage children to learn Portuguese
item.description: The Prime Minister of Timor-Leste, Xanana Gusmão, asked yesterday from parents to encourage children to learn Portuguese, a language that is part of the Timorese identity. "To fathers and mothers, I ask you to encourage your children to learn Portuguese, because, according to our history, it is the Portuguese that represents our identity, not English, nor Indonesian," said Xanana Gusmão. The Timorese Prime Minister spoke at the Government Palace under the celebrations of the World Day of Portuguese Language and the Culture of the Community of Portuguese-Speaking Countries (CPLP) during an activity made by the Portuguese Embassy and the Timorese Ministry of Education, who gathered hundreds of students from the Learning and Formation Center (Cafe Schools), in a march to deliver books to Gusmão Xanana. The head of the Timorese government recalled that for 24 years of Indonesian occupation, the Portuguese language was not taught and that it is necessary to overcome that inheritance so that Timor-Leste does not risk being absorbed again by Indonesia. “Students should study and learn the Portuguese language, because it is the identity of Timor-Leste,” said Xanana Gusmão to the Timorese students, also asking them to thank Portugal for sending teachers. "For us, Timorese, teaching Portuguese is a little difficult, because we do not master the language well, but we thank the Portuguese government for the creation of coffee schools," he added. The project of the Learning and School Training Center or the Cafe Schools began in 2014, and is already present in the 12 Timorese Municipalities and the Oedusi Enclave, on the Indonesian side of Timor Island, and the extent of those educational establishments for administrative posts in the country is also foreseen. Those schools, where classes are given by Portuguese and Timorese teachers, are currently attended by more than 11,100 Timorese students. Cafe has two large pillars, namely quality teaching in the classroom and the complementary training of Timorese teachers. Share the future In those schools, the classes are taught in Portuguese, but students also have classes in Tetum, the second official language of Timor-Leste. Education Minister Dulce Soares stressed that Portuguese is a language of “affection, knowledge and future”. “This is where we share stories, build learning and open new ways,” said Dulce Soares, stressing that the Portuguese language represents diversity, creativity, identity and hope. "Promoting the Portuguese language is also to promote education, cooperation and development," he added. World CPLP World Language and Culture Day was also marked in the National Parliament with a ceremony, which included the attribution of poetry prizes to students, who won a contest to promote Portuguese learning.

item.title: AMCM | Deposits grew 1.3 percent in March
item.description: Resident deposits grew 1.3 percent in March, compared to the previous month, and reached 789 billion patacas, according to data released by the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM). Regarding non-residents, deposits increased by 9.1 percent to 360.1 billion patacas. At the same time, public sector deposits in bank activity decreased slightly to 211.1 billion. As a result, the total deposits of bank activity registered a growth of 3.1 percent when compared to the previous month, reaching 1,360.2 billion. In terms of deposits, the majority, 47.2 percent, concerned money in dollars of Hong Kong, 24 percent in US dollars, 19.1 percent in Patacas, and 2.8 percent Renminbis. At the time of credit, internal loans to the private sector decreased 0.4 percent compared to February to 511.3 billion patacas. In the first quarter of 2025, bank loans related to transportation, storage and communications and restaurants, hotels and the like increased 3.0 percent and 0.3 percent, respectively, when compared to the previous quarter. The loans granted to the thick and retail and construction sector had 3.4 percent and 1.7 percent breaks.

item.description: The Human Rights Watch organization yesterday called for the release of the Hong Kong Anna Kwok human rights defender, detained in late April, and denounced the harassment of territory authorities to family members of activists. Hong Kong police detained the father of the rooted activist in the United States Anna Kwok, "and accused him of a national security crime," he began writing in a statement to Human Rights Watch (HRW), which requires the release of Kwok Yin-Sang and being "immediately withdrawn all charges." Hong Kong National Security Police announced on Friday the arrest of Kwok's father and brother, accused of trying to manage the activist's financial resources. According to police sources, this is the first time that the controversial national security law is applied that criminalizes assistance to “designated fugitives” in the management of the assets that hold. According to the EFE agency on Friday, Hong Kong authorities detained 35 and 68-yearly Anna Kwok's brother and father in Tseung Kwan O district on April 30 and accused the last of trying to raise funds from an insurance policy on the name of their daughter, presenting documents with allegedly false signatures. Anna Kwok, 28, lives in the United States and is a executive director of the Hong Kong Democracy Council, a US -based non -profit organization and created to promote freedoms in China. Although the father remains detained, his brother, an employee of the insurance company who manages Kwok's policies, was released under bail and is being investigated for possible abuse of office to facilitate the operation. Also according to EFE, the authorities have reiterated the warning that anyone who collaborates with “designated fugitives” incurs heavy penalties that can go up to seven years in prison.

item.title: Seismos | Macau will have a monitoring station in national partnership
item.description:
The Secretary for Transport and Public Works, Raymond Tam, presented on Wednesday the report of the 2025 government lines for his tutelage, and said to the deputies that a seismo monitoring station will be created in partnership with interior authorities from China will be created.
The Macao government announced on Wednesday the creation, together with the interior authorities of China, of a seismic monitoring station, as part of the authorities' plans to reinforce disaster prevention. “The meteorological and seismic monitoring network will be optimized, and is foreseen, in collaboration with the competent services of the interior of China, the construction of a seismic monitoring station,” said the secretary for public works and transport, by presenting, in the Legislative Assembly (AL), the lines of government action (LAG) for the guardianship, for 2025. Raymond Tam will justified the new station with the intention of "increasing the capacity for analysis and evaluation in the scope of natural disasters." The space has realized in the direction of the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG), will be located in Hengqin. "Macao's earthly area is small and population density is very high, so it is difficult to find space for the creation of monitoring stations and now with the favorable policies with Guangdong province, we have been able to build a joint monitoring station in the cooperation zone [deepened between Guangdong and Macau]," SMG director Leong Weng Kun said. The official noted that the space should contribute to "increasing prevention capacity and public knowledge about weather information." Agree Macao and Zhuhai signed the “comprehensive and deepened cooperation project in the context of meteorology” to reinforce the cooperation and sharing of meteorological detection equipment, computer programs and data sharing, according to a statement released by SMG at that time. Cooperation is also expected to reinforce the “joint prevention of weather catastrophs alert systems, promote scientific and technological research and the development of artificial intelligence applied to weather activity”. Macao is often affected between May and November by the passage of Tuffons, being July to September the period in which the highest incidence of tropical storms is recorded. This year, the territory is expected to be affected by between five to eight tropical storms, SMG announced in March. Light Metro | Secretary admits operating gaps The Secretary for Transport and Public Works Raymond Tam said on Wednesday that the light meter is still short of the expectations of the population. "I have to confess that the services of the Light Metro, namely the electronic payment services, are still short of the expectations of the population of Macao," he said, promising measures for the means of transport to improve "gradually". Environment | Policies planning will be studied this year The Secretary for Transport and Public Works Raymond Tam announced on Wednesday that this year will be "Study for the Next Planning of Environmental Protection", to support new "environmental policies based on a scientific and prospective view." Still in the area of ​​the environment, the ruler promised measures to achieve the national objective of the “double carbon goal”. As such, concrete emission reduction shares will be driven, including legislative elaboration for the control of emissions from non -road mobile sources, the slaughter of highly polluting vehicles, the improvement of the electric vehicle charging network, the exploitation of the potential application of photovoltaic energy in public spaces and the optimization of the energy structure ”, concluded the report. Housing | Government admits to review the whole policy With the reduction of demand for economic housing, the government admits to review all housing policy. "We are reviewing our policy at this time, taking into account the changes recorded. We will evaluate if there is a need to review the five housing class policy, but it is a subject that is still being studied," said Raymond Tam, secretary for transport and public works in the debate on governance lines for this year. The ruler said that "public housing policies will be reviewed and perfected, promoting the construction of social and economic housing and ensuring rational availability, in order to satisfy the housing needs of residents with different levels of income." Lots of zone A of new landfills should be completed between 2026 and 2028.

item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality was dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, time from Lisbon, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday night [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the guidance issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on the LinkedIn social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. Porém, mais tarde a REN desmentiu estas informações. Muitas questões Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

item.title: Electricity cut affects Portugal, Spain and parts of southern France
item.description: A flaw of electricity affected, at 11:33 (18h33 in Macao), Portugal, Spain and some areas of southern France. In the first moments, information and speculation about the cause of the blackout were disseminated, namely in relation to a possible large-scale cyberataque, a hypothesis that was not excluded in the first instance by the General Secretariat of Internal Administration. Until the closing of this issue, the cause was not yet clear, nor was there an estimate for the return of electricity, but Prime Minister Luís Montenegro said he had hope that the light supply would be resumed yesterday, according to Lisbon time (7 less for Macau). However, there were news in Portuguese media that pointed to the return of electricity in various parts of the country, as well as in Spain. The Expresso newspaper cited data collected by the operators of the electricity network in the Iberian peninsula that pointed to tension imbalances as an explanation for the "blackout" rather than a cyberatheck designed to affect energy infrastructures. Until the closing of this edition, the Portuguese government did not rule out any explanation for the incident. The e-nodes warned that the forecast of electricity replacement remained indefinite and could be prolonged, without advance an estimate. "Given the problems of the network that persist the forecast of energy replacement remains undefined and may be prolonged," said the operator of the electricity distribution network in mainland Portugal, in a statement. E-Redes reiterated that the supply of electricity in Portugal was being affected by upstream constraints of the distribution network, in the very high voltage network in Spain. According to REN - national power grid, yesterday's blackout may have been caused by abnormal temperature fluctuations in Spain. The news was advanced by the BBC, which mentions an atmospheric phenomenon. Pandemonium scenario The incident caused chaos in the country. At airports, check-ins became manuals and began to be announced on flights at first, but were eventually canceled. TAP has issued a statement to appeal to passengers so as not to go to airports, as operation is temporarily conditioned due to blackout. Rail traffic was also totally interrupted throughout the Iberian Peninsula. In hospitals, emergency generators and emergency services and surgeries have been prioritized to respond to urgent cases. In addition to the Emergency Meeting of the Council of Ministers, the National Operational Coordination Center, which is part of the entities in the context of protection and relief operations, gathered to follow the situation and adopt the necessary procedures due to the lack of energy in mainland Portugal. The telephone and computer systems of the National Institute of Emergency Medical was operating until the closing of this edition using generators and the fuel supply posts interrupted the services. On the other hand, the Águas de Portugal (ADP) group appealed to water consumption only for essential uses, “very moderate”, and said there were only “punctual failures”. Heard by Lusa regarding the widespread cutting of electricity and a possible water failure, the company's official source warned that there may be consumer constraints, although without advanced more concrete data. ADP, which brings together more than a dozen water suppliers on the continent, "appeals to the use of water for the essentials only." "ADP is following the situation in all companies," the source said. The company, he added, aims to ensure that essential services have water and recalled that reservoirs have water but it takes energy to transport it, and that even the buildings themselves need energy to get water to consumers taps.

item.title: PME | Events promoted by Melco generated $ 1 million
item.description:
Melco Resorts claims to have generated about $ 1 million for small and medium -sized local businesses through events promoted last year. In the 2024 sustainability report, the game operator also highlights the results in terms of waste management and energy spending
The Melco Resorts & Entertainment Sustainability Report has just been published last year, which highlights the gains obtained by small and medium -sized (SMEs) with the events promoted by the operator. With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. Regarding the company's training actions, Melco says it has invested on average "582 US dollars per full -time worker in learning and development activities, which is equivalent to an average of 38 hours of training." In this context, “100 percent of colleagues participated in training actions”, can be read. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. One of the areas that is “in progress” is the energy consumption, in order to obtain more reasonableness of consumption. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." One of the “achieved” objectives is the energy efficiency measures, which “since 2018 has resulted in an annualized savings of more than 62.5 million kWh, an increase of 9 percent compared to 2023”. Another "achieved" goal concerns the installation of "over 25,000 photovoltaic panels on all properties in Macau, Manila and Cyprus, generating about 10,000 kWh annually." Thus, in the properties of Melco "the electricity consumption from renewable sources increased by 72 percent compared to 2023". Regarding the group's means of transportation, “buses, electric and hybrid vehicles represent 55 percent of our combined fleet, with loading stations, an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023”. In terms of materials and waste management, Melco says it has avoided plastic spending in the order of 13.2 million bottles, thanks to the installation of “the Nordaq water filtering system that serves almost every hotel rooms in Melco's integrated resorts”. In addition, the example of the City of Dreams venture in Manila is presented where “a circular economy system was established in which food waste is decomposed on site, and the excess donated to a local fifth to cultivate some of the vegetables served to guests”. In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023 ″. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unwavering, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our food and drink points in Macao and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Facilitated automatic passage from foreign visitors
item.description:
In the presentation of this year's security lines for security, Wong Sio Chak referred to the idea of ​​facilitating the entry into Macau to foreign visitors, with the creation of more automatic passage points
The Secretary for Security announced, on Friday, plans to accelerate the border control of foreign visitors through the use of automatic electronic channels. During the presentation of the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) to 2025 in the area of ​​security, Wong Sio Chak stated that the territory will extend the use of automatic passage points to foreign citizens without resident or work authorization. To facilitate “exterior exchanges”, authorities will expand autoservice equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, the leader explained. To the deputies at the Legislative Assembly, the secretary added that the government will continue to optimize iris recognition technology in border controls and to study its extension to non-residents this year. "We are also studying ways to widen the number of users eligible for automatic passage channels, allowing more foreign tourists to benefit from faster immigration processes and more fluid circulation in the large bay," Wong said. Speech and company In his speech, the secretary stated that "regarding the creation of a higher level of opening abroad, the input and output services will continue to be optimized and the facilitation measures of the border passage, to ensure a safe, effective, efficient and comfortable passage." Thus, "with a view to promoting the exchange with the outside, the automatic passage channels will also have foreigners, so that they deal with the input and exit inspection formalities through these channels." According to official data, Macau received, in 2024, 34.9 million visitors, 23.8 percent than the previous year, but only 2.42 million were international tourists. In October last year, the Chinese Foreign Ministry extended the Portuguese visa exemption policy, thus inserting Portugal into a list that already covered another 16 European countries. The measure, which allows the Portuguese to stay in China for tourism, business or traffic for a maximum of 15 days, in force at least until December 31, 2025. In the same month, Continental China had announced the expansion, from 90 to 180 days, from the permanence period for foreign residents of Macao on multiple entries in the country. The measure includes permanent and non-permanent foreign residents of Macao that move “to the interior of China for short-term tourism, trade, visit to family members, visits and other activities”. From July, the Chinese National Immigration Administration (NIA) had already allowed foreign permanent residents from Macao and Hong Kong to request authorization to enter the interior of China, valid for a maximum of five years. The measure covers members of the Portuguese community who are permanent residents in Macao and, until then, were required to ask for a visa to travel to the other side of the border.

item.title: April 25 | The Revolution of Cloves seen by the Chinese press
item.description:
The fall of the Estado Novo on April 25, 1974 was reported by the Chinese language press in Macao. Community concerns were revealed, namely about the permanence of the Noble Governor of Carvalho for stability and good business environment, as well as the “status quo” of Macau in the context of decolonization
The echoes of the April 25, 1974 revolution were late in Macao, but this did not mean absence of news in the following days, including the local Chinese press. HM consulted some of the news of the Chinese newspapers of the time over this period, translated to Portuguese by employees of the Press Censorship Commission (CCI), the public body that worked in Macao during the Portuguese dictatorial regime. This material is today to keep the Historical-Diplomatic Archive of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Lisbon. Its reading allows not only to realize some of the events that succeeded the revolution, but also the perceptions and concerns that the Chinese community had on what happened in Portugal. The Chinese wanted to maintain the stability and continuation of business. And if the Noble Governor of Carvalho, in power since 1966, had, for many, connoted with the fascist regime, and therefore had to leave, the truth is that many wanted their permanence to ensure social peace. As read in the book “Macao in the years of the 1974-1979 Portuguese Revolution”, by Garcia Leandro, former Portuguese governor, “Macao's Chinese sought, above all, stability to be able to continue quietly to their business, and did not want conflicts or misunderstandings with Beijing or Canton”. Administration was “weak, very badly supported technically and to be easily corrupted”, so there were “strong reasons for the local MFA [Movement of the Forces] and the CDM [Macao Democratic Center] want to change, especially for the permanent corruption and the sense of excessive weakness of the Portuguese administration, which seemed nothing to decide without preview of Chinese representatives”. MFA explanations Shortly after April 25, Macau was visited by two MFA representatives, namely Major Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro himself, to explain the revolution and objectives of MFA to Portugal and the colonies, not just to the population but to journalists. One of the meetings, with local journalists, was described by the Tai Chung newspaper on May 6, 1974. "Rebelo Gonçalves received the reporters and narrated them in detail the coup d'état. On the day (of the event), the song" Who sends the people "served as a sign of action." The CCI translator attributed to the song “Grandola, Vila Morena”, by José Afonso, chosen to be the second password of the revolution on the radio, the name “Who Mandates is the people”, in reference to the verse of the letter “The people are the one who orders the most”. The news continued, quoting Rebelo Gonçalves: he said "that the coup d'état was the desire of the people, so it achieved success in the period of one day." Support to Nobre de Carvalho Fallen the regime in Lisbon, and exiled Marcelo Caetano, the issue of the Governor's permanence at the head of the destinations of Macao was quickly asked. However, Nobre de Carvalho received popular support to continue, as described from the news of the newspaper SI Man, October 4, 1974. "Portugal does not intend to modify Macau's status quo, a Portuguese delegate told Chinese traders. This delegate manifests himself pleased with the governor's re-competition campaign, promoted by several social sectors. However, Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho had already requested the dismissal of the position of governor for health reasons." In addition, a group was created “for the collection of signatures in favor of the renewal of Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho in the position of Governor of Macao”, which were handed over to Garcia Leandro, still as MFA official. This one received "two boxes containing signatures-cadenic books." "Opinions of entities of industrial and commercial circles were transmitted, hoping that the governor can remain in Macao, which given his wide experiences and knowledge of conditionalisms, can overcome the difficulties resulting from the economic decline that now happens around the world." But if the desire for many was the continuity of Nobre Carvalho, the departure of many civil servants began to be connoted with the change of regime. As referred to in the news of the Jornal Si Man, May 11, 1974. “The head of health and assistance services, Dr. António Joaquim Paulino, will return on the 27th of this month to mainland Portugal, which is reported to fall from Marcelo Caetano's government. The competent authorities refused to comment on the departure of Dr. Paulino.” The newspaper also added: "However, news from Fidente Fonte reported: It is believed that the unappropriate return to Lisbon of Dr. Paulino, whose service commission in this province has not yet ended, is related to the coup (continental). Still in early May, there were still many questions unanswered, and the newspaper SI Man associated the departure of Vasco Rocha Vieira from the territory, at the time of the military command of the Military Command, with the absence of explanations for the political situation. “A fortnight has passed a fortnight after the coup d'état in Portugal has been fully clarified that the political situation of that country was fully clarified. Although Macau is little affected by the event, the chief of staff of Portuguese troops parked in Macao, Major Rocha Vieira yesterday, which led many people to conjecture and suspect the junta of national salvation. Portuguese government had already started acting in Macau. ” Ho Yin's explanations Tai Chung Pou newspaper reported, on May 22, 1974, that "some Portuguese declared in Hong Kong that they were unhappy with the measures taken by the governor and the government of Macao", followed "for the metropolis to ask for the granting of freedom to the Portuguese of Macao." Ho Yin, a striking entrepreneur and figure of the local Chinese community, who dialogue directly with the governor representing the Chinese authorities, explained in a session with “foreign reporters, as well as those of Hong Kong and Macau” about April events. These “visited Mr. Ho Yin, asking him for opinion,” describes Tai Chung Pou. And once again, Ho Yin appealed his spirits, noting that Nobre Carvalho had all the legitimacy to continue as governor. "Since the Portuguese coup d'état, registered on April 25, Macau, given its special circumstances, has been felt, to date, very quiet, not undergoing any change. Mr. Governor, General Nobre de Carvalho, who has been in Macao for over seven years, has deep knowledge of the conditions of this city, having resolved many matters through conversations and wrowning great efforts to this city," Ho Yin told the journalists, according to the journalists, according to the journalists. newspaper report. At the same meeting, the possibility of dissolution of the Legislative Assembly, proposal of the CDM, was questioned. But Ho Yin pushed any sudden political change. “It is known that the Macao Democratic Center, consisting of some Portuguese, requested the dissolution of the Legislative Assembly and the Municipal Council [Leal Senate], as well as the remodeling of some public services. Some inhabitants thought that the assertions of that center would affect the social order, but they came to know that they were only the opinion of a small number of Portuguese, when the city is still the city quiet, after a few days. ” The newspaper adds that Nobre de Carvalho publicly explained "that Al would not be dissolved, so the population of Macao became carefree and entrusted in the prosperity of this city." In addition, “tourists from Hong Kong, as well as abroad, also think Macao is quiet and is not affected at all,” read in Tai Chung Pou. The Seng Pou newspaper also reported this meeting between Ho Yin and journalists, in which the Chinese community leader commented on the benefits of a democratic regime. "Given their peculiar circumstances and due to the fact that the Portuguese and Chinese respected themselves and live in peace for a long time, Macau has not suffered any repercussions resulting from that Portuguese coup," Ho Yin said, stressing that "as for the freedom of the word, it has always existed in Macau." However, the entrepreneur appealed to some containment in the political criticism made. "Democracy and freedom that are now verified in mainland Portugal are happiness to the Portuguese people. And the Portuguese and Chinese have lived in the past in peace, and it is expected to continue to succeed in the future. In the then, criticism of private people or public offices must be founded, since any thoughtless attack would make complications to the question, and affect its tranquility and prosperity." Macau without decolonization One of the questions emanating from April 25, 1974 was the most urgent process of decolonization in the so -called Portuguese Africa where the colonial war was due since 1961. First of all, the authorities clarified that Macau would be left out of this process, because “the Popular Republic of China was careful that in 1972, in the UN decolonization committee, to make it very clear that the future of these two European possessions [Macao and Hong and Hong Kong] would not be part of the agenda of the activities of that body, being the subject treated bilaterally, ”reads in the book of Garcia Leandro. In the September 11, 1974 edition, the Tai Chung Pou newspaper wrote that “the head of the Macao Government Office, Lieutenant Colonel Henrique Manuel Lages Ribeiro, pointed out that news emanating from the news agency Reuters had been misunderstood, and that Macau has a peculiar position”, because “the way to solve his future is different from other Portuguese overseas territories.” The words of Almeida Santos are cited, the Portuguese Minister of Interterritorial Coordination, who said “that it would be allowed to all Portuguese overseas territories to choose the form of independence as a means to solve their own problem, with the exception of Macao that, being a very special territory, requires a special way to solve your problem”. In the translation of this news, there is also a note written by the editor itself: "This means that there is no problem of independence in Macau." The visits by Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro Macau took place in “Finals of May, early June 1974. Almeida Santos was in Macao in September of this year and it was at this stage that Garcia Leandro was chosen governor of Macao, taking office on 13 November of this year.

item.title: Death | Community recalls Pope Francis' dialogue capacity
item.description:
It was 12 years ahead of the destinations of the Catholic Church. Pope Francis died on Monday morning at the age of 88. He also participated in the Easter Sunday celebrations at the Vatican, already quite debilitated. The local Catholic community recalls its legacy of dialogue and management capacity of various crises in the church
Jorge Mario Bergoglio will be forever known as Pope Francis. He died on Monday at the age of 88 hours after celebrating his last Easter before a Vatican crowd. Pope Francis failed to survive the complications of bilateral pneumonia, which forced a prolonged hospitalization for weeks. The news of Pope Francis' dead was the world and the condolence messages and tribute multiplied globally. The local Catholic community was no exception. "No doubt the Catholic community of Macau was very staring Pope Francis a lot, thanks to his smile, no doubt it was a great teaching for the local community. People have always shown a great affection for the Pope," Father Daniel Carvalho told HM. The priest highlighted the fact that Francis was the first Pope from Latin America, more precisely from Argentina, which was "a big news for the church." Contrary to the austere image of his predecessor, Jorge Mario Bergoglio quickly conquered the sympathy of believers and non-decisions for the simplicity and dialogue capacity with various social groups and minorities. "He was a Pope who did not stand out for his intellectuality, but for pastoral work. He proved to be a person of much dialogue, someone merciful, and very close to the simplest, suffering people. He was an extremely accessible pope, showing a side of the church that humanity may not be used to seeing. A nearest, missionary church, open to dialogue." Asked about the future leader of the Catholic Church, Father Daniel Carvalho says it is difficult to point out a possible name for now. "The Catholic Church today has about 120 cardinals, so when the conclave happens there is always an election, and the candidate who gets two thirds of the votes is elected Papa. It is very difficult to get in the figure that will be the next Pope. There are always several possibilities. It is very likely that it is someone from the line of Pope Francis, because many of the current cardinals have been chosen by him. Religion “For All” Stephen Morgan, Rector of the University of St. Joseph (USJ), recalled Pope Francis' words in Lisbon last year during the world's youth days as to the fact that “Catholicism is for everyone, everyone”. "He was able to communicate this, and I think he was also concerned with ensuring that at the highest levels of governance, the church was representative and globally." For Stephen Morgan, Pope Francis “had a communication and connection with people”, and created roots among the Catholic Church in countries in the south of the globe. "Many cardinals were ordered in places like Myanmar, Timor-Leste, or even Mongolia, in a kind of recognition of the global nature of Catholicism, and perhaps it's something in Latin America, from the global southern America, could promote." Over the course of 12 years of pontificate, Pope Francis approached the LGBT community and had to deal with the scandal of sexual abuse within the church. Francisco's position in this field is another point highlighted by Stephen Morgan. "He has done a huge number of things in terms of the church's internal governance, creating mechanisms of liability. I am not sure if the liability has already happened, but these mechanisms, in the crisis of sexual abuse or management of church goods, were really very important. He had an ability to relate to" modern "people because of his informal style," said the USJ rector. As for the future leadership of the Catholic Church, Stephen Morgan also says there are still many possibilities open, taking into account the high number of papal voters. Moreover, "one of the characteristics of this Pope's pontificate was the fact that he did not meet with cardinals many times, and his predecessors tend to meet with the cardinals much more often." "Pope Francis did not do so, so they do not truly know themselves. It can be a very short conclave, with most to say," I know no one, but I know this person. "It may be Tolentino Mendonça, for example. It can take a long time to know each other," he explained. According to Al Jazeera, in January this year there were 252 cardinals, and 138 have election power of the new leader of the Catholic Church. The new Pope will comply with the 267th pontificate. There are several names that may succeed Francis: In addition to the Portuguese Tolentino Mendonça, there is the Cardinals Peter Erddo, Pietro Parolin, Cardinal Secretary of State; Peter Turkson, from Ghana; Luís Tagle, from the Philippines; Mário Grech and Matteo Zuppi. “It is worth mentioning that about 50 percent of the current cardinals come from the global south. Therefore, the idea that the new Pope can be an Asian or African, not a Latin American, is high. But who knows?” He leaves in the air Stephen Morgan. Next journey Pope Francis' funeral will be held within nine days and the conclave to elect his successor within a month, the Vatican announced yesterday after the pontiff's death. This Sunday, Francisco was able to speak, sitting in a wheelchair, in the context of the “Urbi et Orbi” Blessing ceremony: “Urbi”, as it is directed to Rome, and “Orbi”, also directing itself to the whole world. In his message, he deals with an advisor, he denounced the “despicable humanitarian situation” in Gaza, and an appeal was made to ceasefire. Pope Francis also warned of "the climate of growing anti -Semitism that is spreading around the world." "I appeal to belligerents to cease fire, liberate hostages and give precious help to hungry people who yearn for a future of peace," Francisco said in the message. "Pope Francis' self-determined mission was to transform the Catholic Church into a 'campaign hospital' to meet the people where they are, without judging them, healing them with free remedies. So many Catholics loved him deeply," said Stephen Morgan. The Diocese of Macau yesterday issued an official note about the Pope's death, recalling that he "was called to his father's house at the Vatican in Rome at the age of 88." “Throughout his earthly ministry, Pope Francis ardently proclaimed the infinite mercy of God, sowed hope among the faithful, traveled many lands and took care of the most fragile, becoming an exemplary model of pastoral leadership,” is referred to in the note, following a comment by Bishop Stephen Lee. “In this sacred time of the eighth of Easter, Dom Stephen Lee, Bishop of Macau, along with all the brothers and sisters in Christ, raises fervent prayers by the eternal rest of Pope Francis' soul and that he may be received in the glory of the heavenly kingdom. mourning ”, is referred to. The diocese says it will announce the memorial ceremonies of Francisco's death. The note also accounts for the chronology of Francisco's life, namely the birth, on December 17, 1936, in Buenos Aires, with the name of Jorge Mario Bergoglio; and the entrance to the Jesuits in 1958, having been ordered priest in 1969. In 2001 he was ordered cardinal, and about 12 years later he was chosen as a Pope. Beijing condolences China yesterday presented condolences for the death of Pope Francis at the age of 88, and said he intends to continue to develop his relations with the Vatican. Francisco was the first South American and Jesuit Pope in history. "China presents its condolences for the death of Pope Francis," said Guo Jiakun, spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference. The Holy See and China do not maintain official diplomatic relations, since the Vatican is one of about ten countries that recognize Taiwan. However, in 2018, the Pontificate of Francisco signed a historic agreement with the Chinese government about the complex question of the appointment of Catholic bishops in China. "In recent years, China and Vatican have kept constructive contacts and friendly exchanges," said Guo Jiakun. "China is willing to make joint efforts with the Vatican to promote continuous improvement of relationships," he said.
